channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As UK Tries to Curb Immigration, Rural Scotland Looks to Attract Foreign Workers
item.description: Bucking the anti-immigration trend in British politics, remote areas of Scotland would like to attract foreign workers to offset declining local popul...

item.title: A Storm Hit Alaska. Now, a Native Community Is Racing to Save Its History.
item.description: The remnants of Typhoon Halong scattered artifacts from an archaeological site along the shore of the Bering Sea.

item.title: Searching 'weight' can bring up Ozempic in results. It's a drug advertising loophole

item.title: A Planet Money Guide To Five Fascinating Economic Studies
item.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.

item.title: When SNAP benefits will arrive is still in flux. Here's what communities are doing to fill the gap
item.description: Reporters from the NPR Network are covering the uncertainty and lapse in benefits in states across the country.

item.title: New Pentagon Press Crew Is All In on Trump
item.description: The Defense Department’s new press policy led to an exodus of traditional journalists. Supporters of the president have stepped in.

item.title: Chasing Waterfalls on Portugal’s Island of Madeira
item.description: The island, a Portuguese territory, is only 35 miles long, but its mountains are laced with scenic trails, tumbling cascades and inviting villages.

item.title: After Hurricane Melissa, a Seaside Town in Jamaica Picks Up the Pieces
item.description: The devastation caused by Hurricane Melissa in Black River, Jamaica, reflects the broader destruction and rebuilding facing many Jamaican communities.
